dragons.name: Night Fury
dragons.description:
A ghost in the night sky, a whisper of wings before disaster strikes—if you see one, it's already too late. The Night Fury is the fastest dragon known to Vikings, built for speed, stealth, and sheer devastation. Found rarely in taiga forests, this elusive creature wields plasma blasts with uncanny precision—striking harder when hitting its mark rather than simply exploding nearby.

But don't be fooled by old tales calling them demons; earn their trust, and you'll have a fiercely loyal companion who just happens to have a weakness for fish and honey. Oh, and watch out—when cloaked in lightning, they vanish into thin air.

dragons.name: Light Fury
dragons.description:
Like the Night Fury, but with a shimmer as bright as the stars. These mysterious dragons are just as fast and powerful, though their disappearing act is a bit different — no crackling lightning, just a graceful fade into nothingness. If you're lucky enough to spot one, consider it a rare gift.

They share their cousin's love for fish and honey, but don't expect them to stick around long.

dragons.name: Deadly Nadder
dragons.description:
A beauty with a bite — literally. Once considered part of the Sharp class (and for good reason), the Deadly Nadder is covered in razor-sharp spines, particularly along its tail. Cross one, and you might find yourself with fewer limbs than Gobber.

Highly intelligent and agile, this dragon boasts pinpoint accuracy when launching its deadly tail spikes. Add to that its fire-breathing tendencies, and you've got a creature as magnificent as it is dangerous. Found in forests, it has a taste for raw chicken, salmon, and mutton.

dragons.name: Hideous Zippleback
dragons.description:
Two heads, double the trouble. The Hideous Zippleback is a master of deception — one head spews a thick, noxious gas while the other ignites it, turning the battlefield into a firestorm. Found lurking in swamps and savannas, they are patient hunters, emerging at night to disorient their prey before striking.

If you ever find yourself lost in a dense fog that wasn't there a moment ago, best start running.

dragons.name: Gronckle
dragons.description:
Don't let its slow, boulder-like appearance fool you — this dragon is surprisingly nimble in the air, able to fly sideways, backwards, and in loops that would make even the best Viking pilot dizzy. With a head like a battering ram and a tail to match, a Gronckle is built like a living wrecking ball.

Their diet? Rocks. Lots of rocks. And if you're lucky, you can feed them a Gronckle Iron Mixture to create an incredibly strong metal.

dragons.name: Monstrous Nightmare
dragons.description:
If there's one dragon you don't want to anger, it's the Monstrous Nightmare. Massive, aggressive, and fearless, this fire-loving beast coats itself in a highly flammable gel, allowing it to set itself ablaze mid-battle. You'd be wise to keep your distance unless you fancy becoming part of a bonfire.

Valuable resource alert: that fiery gel can be collected with an empty canister. Just be sure to stay in one piece while doing it.

dragons.name: Whispering Death
dragons.description:
There's an old Viking saying: “If the ground rumbles and whispers, run.” The Whispering Death is a subterranean nightmare, tunneling through rock and soil with ease. Poor eyesight doesn't slow it down — its rows of rotating teeth and iron-like scales make up for that.

It has the strongest bite of any dragon, and to make matters worse, it never stops moving. If you hear that eerie whisper, you're already too close.

dragons.name: Smothering Smokebreath
dragons.description:
Small, swift, and sneaky, these little dragons are more than just a nuisance — they're master thieves, hoarding metal to build their nests. Alone, they can be pesky. In groups, they can blanket an entire battlefield in thick, impenetrable smoke, making them nearly impossible to fight.

They favor fish and anything shiny, so guard your treasure carefully — or say goodbye to your weapons.

dragons.name: Flightmare
dragons.description:
A glowing specter in the night, the Flightmare is a dragon of legend. Its eerie blue glow comes from a diet rich in glowing algae, and its mist isn't just for show — it can paralyze prey (and Vikings) in their tracks.

This dragon is as temperamental as it is territorial, fiercely guarding its algae supply. Many a Viking has been left “scared stiff” by its haunting presence, leading to centuries of ghost stories and spine-chilling warnings.

dragons.name: Hobgobbler
dragons.description:
Tiny, gluttonous, and chaotic, Hobgobblers have a simple motto: “If it fits in my mouth, it's food.” This means they'll eat almost anything—including things they probably shouldn't. They may be small, but their insatiable appetite makes them unpredictable.

Surprisingly loyal (and annoying), these little dragons will follow you around relentlessly if you feed them fish. Just don't leave them alone near your supplies, unless you enjoy discovering half-eaten weapons and missing valuables.

dragons.name: Night Terror
dragons.description: Dragon from the Hiccup's Legacy mod

dragons.name: Terrible Terror
dragons.description: This little guy is found almost anywhere. Contraty to what the name implies, they are neutral creatures, mostly oblivious until you disturb them. Their diet consists of mostly fish, chicken and bread. Their chirping can be annoying when in crowds.

dragons.name: Fireworm
dragons.description: Dragon from the Hiccup's Legacy mod

dragons.description: Dragon from the Hiccup's Legacy mod

dragons.description: Dragon from the Hiccup's Legacy mod
